title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 28 October 2016 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has quit  
03:25 <jonesmeier> has quit  
03:27 <jonesmeier> has joined #xwiki  
04:40 <boubou> has quit  
06:37 <boubou> has joined #xwiki  
07:32 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
08:50 <boubou> has quit  
09:19 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <boubou> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:12 <boubou> has quit  
11:21 <Chris[m]> has quit  
11:21 <M-vmassol> has quit  
11:21 <M-cjd> has quit  
11:21 <M-mouhb> has quit  
11:21 <M-yflory> has quit  
11:21 <Craeckie[m]> has quit  
11:21 <blabla2[m]> has quit  
11:21 <aloisdg[m]> has quit  
11:21 <M-jsimard> has quit  
11:21 <jihad[m]> has quit  
11:29 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:33 <Pbas> hello, I have an issue with DW on xwiki 8.3:  it is impossible to update extension: timeout errors  
11:34 <Pbas> I updgraded 8.2.1 and 7.01 xwiki version, same problem when DW from 8.3 version is launched  
11:37 <blabla2[m]> has joined #xwiki  
11:37 <Pbas> I have this error: Unexpected error when trying to find versions for extension with id [org.xwiki.contrib:check-security]  
11:38 <Pbas> and same for all extension:  Unexpected error when trying to find versions for extension with id [org.xwiki.enterprise:xwiki-enterprise-ui-mainwiki]  
11:42 <ClemensR> Pbas: which java version are you using ?  
11:42 <aloisdg[m]> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <Craeckie[m]> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <Chris[m]> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <M-mouhb> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <M-cjd> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <M-yflory> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <M-jsimard> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <jihad[m]> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <M-vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <Pbas> this one: JAVA\_HOME=/opt/jdk1.8.0\_101  
11:43 <Pbas> and tomcat 8.0.33  
11:43 <ClemensR> ah, ok, then it is no the issue that I had  
11:43 <Pbas> ho you have the same issue?  
11:44 <ClemensR> well, together with some other issues, which were causes by an old java version - so not your issue  
11:44 <boubou> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <Pbas> On same plateform, 8.2.1 upgrade working well but not 8.3 upgrade  
11:46 <ClemensR> also it was a new install .... oh, 8.2.1 is working?  is there something in the logs ?  
11:47 <Pbas> No it is an upgrade from 7.0.1 (I tested upgrade from 8.2.1 too). Nothing in logs about extension update  
11:47 <Pbas> 8.2.1 update and 8.2.1 working well  
11:47 <Pbas> update/upgrade  
11:48 <ClemensR> I just thought about the timeout ... but it seems I am on the wrong track  
11:49 <Pbas> sorry about log: I found something  
11:49 <Pbas> aused by: org.hibernate.HibernateException: Failed updating schema while executing query [create table XWiki.org网站>>http.activitystream\_events (ase\_eventid varchar(48) not null, ase\_requestid va  
11:50 <Pbas> but with 8.2.1 upgrade I had same error about chiness characters and database schema...  
11:52 <Pbas> may be on 8.3 theses chiness characters blocking extension update  
11:56 <ClemensR> has quit  
11:57 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
12:00 <Pbas> hum same thing on xwikiPrefernces screen: /bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences: impossible to check extension update (after a tomcat restart)  
12:00 <Pbas> org.xwiki.extension.ResolveException: Failed to create extension object for extension [jdom:jdom-1.1.3]  
12:02 <Pbas> Ho maybe it is a https passthrough proxy problem because (Connect to store.xwiki.com:443)  
12:04 <Pbas> I will add -Dhttps.proxyHost (I have only -Dhttp.proxyHost) and relauch after lunch :-)  
12:09 <Pbas> unable to find valid certification path to requested target    now on XwikiPreference (must eat to concentrate) thxs anyway  
12:15 <ClemensR> looks like it is the certificate problem with the old java version; maybe the upgrade managed to choose an old java version somehow?  
12:28 <boubou> has quit  
13:12 <Pbas> Nope :-/ but I fix it with http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6908948/java-sun-security-provider-certpath-suncertpathbuilderexception-unable-to-find  
13:12 <Pbas> I add  -Djavax.net.ssl.trustStore=/home/opt/jdk1.8.0\_101/jre/lib/security/cacerts in my java\_opts in catalina.sh  
13:13 <Pbas> probably extension upgrade use https since 8.3 version  
13:13 <Pbas> thx anyway :)  
13:20 <ClemensR> strange. these should be available by default, but glad that you found a solution!  
13:31 <Pbas> yes ... let's go to the next issue ;-) (ldap authentication: I must add/install extension now)  
13:46 <Pbas> ldap authentication failed, I add ldap authentication 9.1, but I can not add logging com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.ldap and com.xpn.xwiki.user.impl.LDAP  
13:47 <Pbas> because it is not display in LT of /bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin&section=Logging page  
13:48 <Pbas> and ... on "LDAP Authenticator 9.1" extension if I click on "display detail"=> Failed to execute the [velocity] macro. Cause: [null]. Click on this message for details.  
13:50 <vmassol> has quit  
13:54 <ClemensR> but the ldap auth class is set in xwiki.cfg ? looks like it is not  
13:55 <tmortagne> Pbas: store.xwiki.com is not need for upgrade anyway so your issue is something else  
13:55 <Pbas> yes it is: xwiki.authentication.authclass=com.xpn.xwiki.user.impl.LDAP.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl  
13:55 <tmortagne> ha that's different  
13:55 <tmortagne> com.xpn.xwiki.user.impl.LDAP.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl is not included in 8.3 anymore  
13:56 <tmortagne> see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/Data/XWiki/8.3/#HLDAPModulemovedtoContrib  
13:56 <Pbas> I though we can set ldap parameter in xwiki.cfg still  
13:57 <tmortagne> LDAP parameters still go in xwiki.cfg but the default generated xwiki.cfg don't contain them anymore, you need to add them  
13:57 <tmortagne> i.e. it's an optional extension now  
13:58 <Pbas> Ok I must set my old ldap parameter in xwiki.cfg like previous xwiki version? and must install ldap extension? Am I right?  
13:59 <tmortagne> Pbas: yes the new extension is fully retro compatible so the same parameter will work except for xwiki.authentication.authclass which is different  
13:59 <tmortagne> it's the same authenticator which has been moved plus a few bonuses, not really a rewrite  
14:00 <Pbas> Failed to initialize AuthService com.xpn.xwiki.user.impl.LDAP.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl using Reflection, trying default implementations using 'new'.  
14:00 <Pbas> I must remove com.xpn.xwiki.user.impl.LDAP.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImp from xwiki.cfg I suppose  
14:01 <tmortagne> again you need to change xwiki.authentication.authclass  
14:01 <tmortagne> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Authenticator/#HGenericLDAPconfiguration  
14:02 <Pbas> ho ty, I will test it  
14:06 <Pbas> (it is strange than authentication is contrib now because to install ldap extension we must authenticate first)  
14:06 <Pbas> it doesn't work i must read better your doc  
14:10 <Pbas> is it ok with this line? http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Authenticator/#HLogbackconfigurationfile  
14:11 <Pbas> must be <logger name="org.xwiki.contrib.ldap" level="trace"/> instead ?  
14:14 <tmortagne> Pbas: yes, fixed the package name in the doc (I usually use the UI)  
14:15 <Pbas> ok I didn't manage to use ldap authentication, but it seem ldap extension is not installed correctly  
14:16 <Pbas> I don't see a ldap section in xwikipreference and logs neither  
14:17 <tmortagne> Pbas: do you see it in "installed extensions" ?  
14:18 <Pbas> yes installed but if I click on "display details" I have velocity error  
14:18 <Pbas> I haven't this problem with other extension  
14:18 <tmortagne> that's weird, try to restart maybe  
14:19 <Pbas> already done! (but I will remove and reinstall ldap extension)  
14:20 <Daemoen> has quit  
14:26 <tmortagne> Pbas: you sure you have xwiki.authentication.authclass=org.xwiki.contrib.ldap.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl in xwiki.cfg and not related error in the log when you start (when you access the first page) ?  
14:26 <tmortagne> (if xwiki.authentication.authclass is not configured then LDAP authenticator is not loaded and indeed you won't see it in the Logging UI)  
14:27 <tmortagne> the Logging UI does not list all the class, only those that have been loaded  
14:27 <tmortagne> s/class/classes/  
14:28 <Pbas> I testing (slow machine) :-)  
14:29 <Pbas> Ok I see org.xwiki.contrib.ldap in logging section of xwikipreference now  
14:30 <tmortagne> ok so at least it means that's your authenticator  
14:30 <Pbas> no ldap section in UI, I will restart  
14:30 <tmortagne> that's different  
14:30 <tmortagne> you only installed the authenticator  
14:30 <tmortagne> not the UI  
14:30 <tmortagne> so yes you don't have any UI  
14:30 <tmortagne> but it's not required if you use xwiki.cfg  
14:31 <Pbas> it doesn't matter about ui becasue all my ldap setting are in xwiki.cfg  
14:31 <Pbas> yes  
14:31 <tmortagne> so don't install the UI  
14:31 <tmortagne> (I only use xwiki.cfg usually too)  
14:31 <tmortagne> it was optional before and it still is :)  
14:31 <Pbas> :) (vi is better)  
14:32 <tmortagne> so you copy/pasted the exact same ldap properties you had in the previous xwiki.cfg and it does not work ?  
14:33 <Pbas> yes (except xwiki.authentication.authclass)  
14:33 <Pbas> DEBUG x.c.l.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl - The provided user is null. We don't try to authenticate, it probably means the user is in non logged mode.  
14:33 <tmortagne> that's normal  
14:33 <tmortagne> it's when you access a page as guest  
14:34 <tmortagne> what's important is the log produced when you authenticate  
14:35 <Pbas> hum strange: "LDAP user pascal.bastien does not belong to LDAP group"  
14:35 <tmortagne> you should see the members that were found for the group  
14:35 <Pbas> maybe it is because I use implicit group now?  
14:35 <tmortagne> and the group it searched  
14:36 <Pbas> ha yes "Failed to get group members"  
14:36 <Pbas> com.novell.ldap.InterThreadException: LDAP Timeout :-(  
14:36 <daemoen> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <tmortagne> you can use xwiki.authentication.ldap.timeout to increase the timeout, the default is 1s I think  
14:37 <Pbas> Is it shorter than previous version?  
14:37 <tmortagne> no  
14:38 <Pbas> :q  
14:38 <tmortagne> by default it's just not set actually and the LDAP lib did not changed  
14:38 <Pbas> Ok I will increase but I wonder if it is not a certificat problem  
14:38 <tmortagne> it's LDAPS ?  
14:39 <Pbas> yes and I add this option in catalina.sh: -Djavax.net.ssl.trustStore=/home/opt/jdk1.8.0\_101/jre/lib/security/cacerts  
14:40 <tmortagne> I guess if there was a certificate issue it could not even bind to the LDAP server and it's passed that if it tried to load a group  
14:40 <Pbas> I will remove my java option like previous 8.2.1 version to test  
14:45 <Pbas> ok my ldap authentication work now but I cannot install new extension (I must choose). Maybe I can use 2 "-Djavax.net.ssl.trustStore"?  
14:46 <Pbas> I will set xwiki.authentication.ldap.ssl.keystore and test  
14:47 <Pbas> (yes I know I'm working like a piggy)  
14:58 <Pbas> nope: unable to find valid certification path to requested target (I must remove xwiki.authentication.ldap.ssl.keystore)  
14:59 <Pbas> strange with my ldap cert in java\_opts, ldap authentication working well but update extension display "unable to find valid certification path to requested target "  
15:08 <Pbas> Ok with previous xwiki version I generated jssecacerts with http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-865 (add support for LDAP over SSL (ldaps) and copy this one  in /opt/jdk1.8.0\_101/jre/lib/security/ but now with xwiki 8.3 version extension install need https  
15:08 <M-jsimard> has quit  
15:08 <Chris[m]> has quit  
15:08 <M-mouhb> has quit  
15:08 <blabla2[m]> has quit  
15:08 <Craeckie[m]> has quit  
15:08 <jihad[m]> has quit  
15:08 <M-vmassol> has quit  
15:17 <tmortagne> Pbas: unfortunately I don't have much experience with LDAPS so you probably know more than me by now, all I can say is that nothing changed in that area  
15:17 <Pbas> the problem is  
15:17 <Pbas> ldaps use my certificat and extension another one with 8.3 version fior https  
15:18 <Pbas> I must found a way to use both  
15:19 <Pbas> because extension updater need https now  
15:20 <blabla2[m]> has joined #xwiki  
15:20 <tmortagne> Pbas: it's not extension updater  
15:21 <tmortagne> store.xwiki.com is behind https but not the others and right now store.xwiki.com does not contain any extension  
15:21 <Pbas> it is the extension repository?  
15:21 <tmortagne> it's one extension repository  
15:21 <Pbas> ok  
15:21 <tmortagne> the default repositories are:  
15:21 <tmortagne> \* store.xwiki.com  
15:22 <tmortagne> nexus.xwiki.org alone is enough for upgrades  
15:22 <tmortagne> (and it's still HTTP, but it will probably change at some point it's it would be cleaner to use HTTPS)  
15:25 <Pbas> Agree. https is cleaner, I must find a way to use my both cert (I will retry xwiki.authentication.ldap.ssl.keystore option)  
15:31 <Christian[m]> has joined #xwiki  
15:31 <x[m]> has joined #xwiki  
15:31 <aloisdg[m]> has joined #xwiki  
15:31 <cjd[m]> has joined #xwiki  
15:31 <vmassol[m]> has joined #xwiki  
15:31 <yflory[m]> has joined #xwiki  
15:32 <msmeria> has quit  
15:43 <Pbas> hum on different doc and http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-865: If the file jssecacerts (my cert for ldapS) exists, then cacerts (cert for extension repository) is not consulted :-/  
15:43 <barretto> has joined #xwiki  
15:44 <Pbas> I suppose I must againt regenerate my ldapS cert with actual cacerts  
15:47 <Pbas> (need to search my ldap cerficate)  
15:50 <barretto> hi! I'm looking for a proper way of generate and keep user activity log ( like create, edit and delete pages).  Activity Stream Application seems to be a nice candidate but I cant find any documentation about how it stores this activity for later analysis..  
15:51 <barretto> would appreciate any tips  
15:51 <barretto> :)  
15:52 <barretto> this log would be useful in auditing, for example  
15:56 <Pbas> Hello, may be you can watch inside this extension: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/CleanActivityStream  
15:57 <Pbas> activity entry are in a table and you have an api to read them  
15:58 <Pbas> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ScriptingDocumentation/?url=http:%2F%2Fnexus.xwiki.org%2Fnexus%2Fservice%2Flocal%2Frepositories%2Fpublic%2Farchive%2Forg%2Fxwiki%2Fplatform%2Fxwiki-platform-activitystream-api%2F8.2.1%2Fxwiki-platform-activitystream-api-8.2.1-javadoc.jar%2F!%2Fcom%2Fxpn%2Fxwiki%2Fplugin%2Factivitystream%2Fplugin%2FActivityStreamPluginApi.html  
16:19 <Pbas> hum about my certificate problem: I reimport my ldapS certificate, ldap authentication working but extension updater display certificate errors :-/  
16:29 <Pbas> I don't know if I must create a jira issue about my problem: (using ldapS vs update extension in httpS)?  
16:30 <Pbas> I don't know if we can use both in same time (because different certificat: an autosigned one and private one)  
16:30 <Pbas> s/an autosigned one/public one  
16:32 <Pbas> I will send a message in xwiki user list first (maybe someone found a way)  
16:32 <ClemensR> you might be able to use the "keytool" to merge the certificates into one store:  https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/security/toolsign/rstep2.html  
16:34 <Pbas> yes thxs I already did that, (it is indicate here  http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-865)  
16:36 <Pbas> but the problem is: If the file jssecacerts exists, then cacerts is not consulted  
16:37 <mflorea> has quit  
16:37 <ClemensR> ah, I though you could merge the jssecacerts and cacerts with that, too, but I misunderstood  
16:38 <Pbas> no you well understand, I just failed to do it: I have an error when I try to import cacert file  
16:40 <Pbas> (I will test to import my ldapS into cacerts)  
16:48 <Pbas> YES!  
16:48 <Pbas> I understand now (I will comment jira issue)  
16:49 <Pbas> /lib/security/cacerts is already a key store and before 8.3 version I created a new keystore for ldapS  
16:50 <Pbas> /lib/security/jssecacerts  
16:51 <Pbas> but since 8.3, xwiki/java need 2 certificate for httpS and ldapS, I simply (yes I know it is simple when we found answer) add my ldapS cert in existent key store cacerts (with all keys)  
16:52 <Pbas> Cool I can go home for the WE now (I don't like issue in my head during WE) :-)  
16:54 <ClemensR> ok, phew :)  
16:55 <Pbas> hé hé like you said! phew! ty you both for your support :)  
17:01 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
17:24 <Pbas> Here my comment: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-865?focusedCommentId=93213&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-93213  
17:25 <Pbas> have a nice WE. bye  
17:25 <ClemensR> bye, Pbas!  
17:38 <Pbas> has quit  
17:57 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki
